keyTakeAways: The Amazon cloud outage exposed how deeply dependent modern internet services are on a small number of technology providers.
The outage affected over 2,500 companies, including major services like Snapchat, Roblox, Fortnite, Robinhood, Netflix, Disney+, and the Canvas learning platform.
Amazon blamed the issue on problems within its domain name system (DNS), which converts web addresses to IP addresses, leading to widespread service failures.
Many educational institutions, including universities like UC Riverside and Ohio State University, were unable to deliver online coursework and assignments.
The recovery process was described as slow and bumpy, with intermittent disruptions as engineers rolled out fixes.
Experts like Mike Chapple and Patrick Burgess emphasized that such outages are typically due to technical failures, not cyberattacks, and are usually resolved within hours.
This incident highlights the fragility of internet infrastructure when reliant on a few major cloud providers like Amazon Web Services (AWS).

summaryOfNewsArticle: A massive outage of Amazon’s cloud computing service, Amazon Web Services (AWS), disrupted internet services worldwide on Monday, affecting major platforms such as social media, gaming, financial apps, streaming services, and educational tools like Canvas. The outage, traced to issues within AWS’s domain name system (DNS), began around 3:11 a.m. Eastern time and was not fully resolved until 6 p.m. Eastern. The failure impacted services including Snapchat, Roblox, Fortnite, Robinhood, Netflix, Disney+, Coinbase, and Signal. Students at universities like UC Riverside and Ohio State University were unable to access course materials or submit assignments. Experts noted that such outages are typically due to technical failures, not cyberattacks, and are usually resolved within hours. This event underscores the growing vulnerability of modern digital infrastructure, which now relies heavily on just a few major cloud providers.
title: Amazon Cloud Outage Exposes Internet’s Fragile Backbone
